explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified into Category 3 since flash point 52 degC (closed-cup) (HSDB (2006)) is >=23 degC and <=60 degC. Data are available that flash point is 71 degC (closed-cup) (Solvents Handbook, Ohmsha Ltd. (1994)). It is >60 degC and <=93 degC, and falls into Category 4. However, the classification was classified into Category 3 by adopting lower flash point.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Auto-ignition point is 295 degC (GESTIS (access on 8, 2009)) exceeding 70 degC.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance is an organic compound containing oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: LD50 values are 3.2 g/kg, >5 g/kg and 9.2 g/kg for rats (PATTY (5th, 2001)). Since one value corresponds to Category 5 and two values correspond to "Not classified", the substance was classified as "Not classified" in JIS Classification (correspond to Category 5 or "Not classified" in GHS classification).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of >5 g/kg for rabbits (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, a LC50 value was >2132 ppm/6h (16.77 mg/L/4h) for rats (RTECS (2006)). Since the LC50 value (2132 ppm) was higher than saturated vapour pressure concentration (1776 ppm), the test was considered to be conducted for mists.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on results of "slight irritation" in a rabbit test where 500 mg was applied to the skin for 24-hour (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and "not irritation" in 48-hour patch test with human subjects (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified as "Not classified" in JIS Classification (correspond to Category 3 in GHS classification).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on a result of "slight irritation" in a rabbit test where undiluted substance was applied to the eye (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into Category 2.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there are results that no skin sensitization reactions were noted in patch test on 25 human subjects (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and that no skin sensitizing was induced in modified Draize test using animals (PATTY (5th, 2001)), classification was not possible since the detailed data such as test methods and results are not clear.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data from in vivo mutagenicity tests. From in vitro mutagenicity tests, there is a report of a negative Ames test (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: When guinea pigs were exposed to saturated atmospheres, exposure for 10-hour produced evidence of central nervous system depression, and after 12-hour of exposure, the animals were comatose (PATTY (5th, 2001)). In addition, based on a report for human effects that inhalation may cause CNS depression at high concentrations (HSDB (2006)), the substance was classified into Category 3 (narcotic effects). On the other hand, based on reports that guinea pigs exposed to saturated atmospheres developed immediate signs of nasal irritation and that respiratory depression was reported in mice a inhalation test, and that inhalation may produce mild symptoms of throat irritation at low concentrations as human information (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3 from its 96h-LC50 = 36 mg/L for fish (Fathead minnow) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3 since its acute toxicity is Category 3 and there are no data on rapid degradation.
